paper_abstract: In this article, we propose a new method for passive fault-tolerant control of discrete time piecewise affine systems. Actuator faults are considered. A reliable piecewise linear quadratic regulator state feedback is designed such that it can tolerate actuator faults. A sufficient condition for the existence of a passive fault-tolerant controller is derived and formulated as the feasibility of a set of linear matrix inequalities (LMIs). The upper bound on the performance cost can be minimised using a convex optimisation problem with LMI constraints which can be solved efficiently. The approach is illustrated on a numerical example and a two degree of freedom helicopter.
paper_title: Passive fault-tolerant control of discrete time piecewise affine systems against actuator faults
